snippet: Mitt Romney apparently pulled off a narrow victory over Rick Santorum in Ohio. But Mr. Santorum scored victories elsewhere, competing with Mr. Romney’s achievement of collecting the most delegates.
abstract: Mitt Romney appears to pull off a narrow victory in Ohio on Super Tuesday, but loses several other states to Rick Santorum; split verdict overshadows Romney's claim of collecting the most delegates and all but ensures another round of intense infighting on the road to the Republican presidential nomination.

byline.contributor: Ashley Parker, Allison Kopicki and David R. Jones contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney apparently pulled off a narrow victory over Rick Santorum in Ohio. But Mr. Santorum scored victories elsewhere, competing with Mr. Romney’s achievement of collecting the most delegates.

headline.main: Romney Appears the Ohio Winner; Santorum Strong
headline.print_headline: Romney Appears The Ohio Winner; Santorum Strong
